DOC.brief_summary: The aim study investigate safety effectiveness buprenorphine presence naltrexone treatment cocaine dependence .
DOC.detailed_description: This project assess utility buprenorphine presence naltrexone potential medication useful reduce cocaine use , commence research direction great importance theoretical practical addiction medicine . Buprenorphine provide sublingual buprenorphine+naloxone tablet ( Suboxone® , `` BUP '' ) . Naltrexone provide extended-release naltrexone injection ( Vivitrol® , `` XR-NTX '' ) . In multi-center , double-blind , placebo-controlled trial , participant randomly assign one three medication condition : 4mg buprenorphine plus naltrexone ( BUP4+XR-NTX ) , 16mg buprenorphine plus naltrexone ( BUP16+XR-NTX ) , placebo plus naltrexone ( PLB+XR-NTX ) 8 week treatment . Participants schedule clinic visit three time weekly ( total 24 visit across 8-week treatment period ) observe medication administration , provision take-home medication , collection safety , medical , drug use , psychological , compliance measure . In addition , participant schedule once-weekly individual Cognitive Behavioral Therapy ( CBT ) session . This protocol explore effect three medication condition test buprenorphine possible treatment cocaine dependence . This study advance science , provide dose information , characterize effect combination two medication population .
